newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Santer says EU sticks to position on BSE.
newsitem.headline: Santer says EU sticks to position on BSE.

text.p: European Commission President Jacques Santer said on Friday that Britain's decision to hold up a planned cull of cattle at risk from mad cow disease had not influenced Europe's view of the issue.
"The position of the Commission has not changed," he told a Reuters Television reporter at the Commission's Brussels headquarters.

The British government on Thursday said it was putting a full-scale cull of beef cattle most at risk from bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE) on hold because of evidence from researchers that the disease would die out in five years.

The European Union, however, has rejected such a move saying Britain should carry out a plan to slaughter up to 147,000 as part of an agreement that would eventually lead to the lifting of its worldwide ban on British beef exports.
Santer declined to comment further on the British move.
